column4: Hi guys, I would like to install the display drivers for my new Acer Netbook D255-1268 (runs on dualcore N550).  So far, the only thing I have tried is to run the Additional drivers wizard found in the systems menu. Any ideas?
that should work. what are you getting when you activate recommended?
nothing comes up unfortunately
do you have nvidia video?
Mrdebuntu. I'm to quite sure. I could check the specifications
let me check
have you ran update manager first?
yes, I ran the update manager
is there an issue with your display?
no, not really other than that the FXs are all grayed out in the Visual appearance ! Visual effects
hmm ok. it may be a newer intel graphics chip.  the intel driver is typically automatically installed and features 3d effects in linux

The main reason that motivated me to try to download new video drivers is because my mouse is very quick to go all over the place when I type.. In one forum, someone was suggesting to download new video drivers (I don't see what the reason for doing so is)
Mrdebuntu: Here are my specs: Display: 10.1-inch (1024 x 600) 200-nitere TFT LCD
Chipset: Mobile Intel NM10 Express
Graphics: Integrated Intel Graphics Media Accelerator 3150
all right. well, i will research your particular model and see i find anything. as far as i know, the driver should automatically work for intel, sans some newer chipset models.
Mrdebuntu: Like you say, maybe it's too recent... Would you have a work around for preventing mouse to go all over the place whilst typing?
what about the mouse settings? have you experimented with changing acceleration there?

Mrdebuntu: I don't know exactly what happens but my mouse goes all over the place at times.. Windows close and open... I don't really know if it's due to the mouse or something else... Sometimes I will see my mouse pointer go all over the place really quick!

Mrdebuntu: Conservatively, I disabled the scrolling feature under mouse settings and flagged disable touchpad while typing  but that doesn't seem to make a difference. When I say I have problem with my mouse, I should have referred to it as the touchpad. Sorry. No! It's an Acer netbook.
ok
